publicwhip.spmotion: S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-2688 Cathy Peattie: Equalities Review—That the Parliament welcomes the Department of Trade and Industry and Cabinet Office’s decision to set up an equalities review to examine the long-term and underlying causes of inequality that need to be addressed by public policy; expresses disappointment that there is no Scottish representative on the review team, and calls on the Scottish Executive to take measures to ensure that the work of the review and the recommendations it makes fully encompass Scotland. Supported by: Donald Gorrie
S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Marlyn Glen*
S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Ms Sandra White*, Jackie Baillie*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*, Michael McMahon*, Linda Fabiani*

S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Karen Whitefield*, Nora Radcliffe*, Patrick Harvie*, Mike Watson*, Elaine Smith*, Alex Neil*, Shiona Baird*, Trish Godman*, Margaret Jamieson*, Margaret Smith*, Helen Eadie*, Eleanor Scott*, Chris Ballance*, Dr Elaine Murray*
S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Sarah Boyack*
S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Maureen Macmillan*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-2688 Equalities Review (lodged on 11 April 2005) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
